spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The aboleth's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The deva has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The deva makes two attacks.

action.name: Celestial Hammer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 17 ({@damage 5d6}) radiant damage. On a hit, the target can't make opportunityattacks against the deva until the beginning of the target's next turn.

bonus.name: Bonus
entries: Entries

reaction.name: Self-Sacrifice
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of the thrall that the thrall can see hits an aboleth with an attack, the thrall can make itself the target of the attack instead.

legendary.name: Legendary action
entries: Entries for legendary action

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The dryad has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Speak with Nature
entries: The dryad can communicate with beasts and plants.

trait.name: Fungal Pathway
entries: Once per turn, the mykand can use 10 feet of movement to enter a mushroom ring and then teleport up to 30 feet away.

trait.name: Mykand Resilience
entries: The mykand cannot become diseased.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The mykand ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Club
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Sling
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Dragon's Head Mushroom (3/Day)
entries: Plucking a red-topped mushroom that bears a loose similarity to a dragon's head from a hidden pocket, the mykand throws it at a spot it can see within 30 feet where it bursts, releasing a cloud of black spores in a 10-foot radius. Each creature in the area aside from a mykand must make a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature is {@condition frightened}. While {@condition frightened} in this way, it regards any Dragon's Head Mushrooms it can see with abject terror, and must use its movement each turn to get out of sight of it. A creature can repeat this saving throw if the mykand or the mykand's allies harm it, ending the effect on a success. Otherwise, the effect lasts 24 hours. If the creature succeeds on a saving throw against the Dragon's Head Mushrooms or the effect ends for it, it is immune to Dragon's Head Mushrooms for 24 hours.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The raptor has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the raptor's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and not {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Wall Walker
entries: The spawn can use its climb speed even on difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Kanos spawn makes two attacks with its claws.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it makes a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw, falling {@condition prone} on a failure.

action.name: Icy Breath (Recharge 6)
entries: The spawn releases an icy blast of frigid air in a 20-foot cone. All creatures in the area must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) cold damage and becoming {@condition restrained} by a layer of ice on a failure. On a succcess, the creature takes half damage and is not {@condition restrained}. Creatures remain {@condition restrained} for 1 minute or until they spend an action to free themselves.
Until the start of its next turn the area is lightly obscured and the spawn can use a bonus action to attempt to hide, making its Stealth check with advantage.

trait.name: Combat Maneuvers (6 exertion/Rest)
entries: Abtazri knows the Tempered Iron and Tooth and Claw combat traditions. Her maneuver DC is 16. She can spend exertion to activate the following combat maneuvers:

items.name: Tempered Iron
entries: {@spell imposing glare|LevelUp} (1st), {@spell purge magic|LevelUp} (1st), {@spell zealous stance|LevelUp} (1st), {@spell faith within|LevelUp} (2nd), {@spell gaze of conviction|LevelUp} (2nd)

items.name: Tooth and Claw
entries: {@spell expert tumble|LevelUp} (2nd), {@spell primal intercept|LevelUp} (2nd)

trait.name: Fighting Style: Technical Fighting
entries: WHenever Abtazri uses a combat maneuver, any damage dealt by attacks using it deals an additional 2 damage, and her maneuver DC increases by 1 (included above).

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Abtazri's weapon attacks count as magical for the purposes of overcoming damage resistances and immunities.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Abtazri makes two attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) slashing damage. If Abtazri moves at least 10 feet towards her target before making this attack, she gains advantage on the attack.

action.name: +2 Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) magical piercing damage. Immediately after hitting or missing the target after it is thrown, the +2 spear reappears in Abtazri's claws.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Kadderia is a 6th-level spellcaster. Their spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, +7 to hit with spell attacks). They can cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Sorcery Points (6/day)
entries: Kadderia can expend sorcery points to enhance spells with metamagic.

items.name: Quickened Spell
entries: When Kadderia casts a spell that has a casting time of 1 action, they can spend 2 sorcery points to change the casting time to 1 bonus action for this casting.

items.name: Subtle Spell
entries: When Kadderia casts a spell, they can spend 1 sorcery point to cast it without any seen or verbalised components.

items.name: Twinned Spell
entries: When Kadderia casts a spell that targets only one creature and doesn't have a range of self, they can spend a number of sorcery points equal to the spell's level to target a second creature in range with the same spell (1 sorcery point if the spell is a cantrip). To be eligible for Twinned Spell, a spell must be incapable of targeting more than one creature at the spell's current level.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: Kadderia doesn't provoke an opportunity attack when they fly out of a creature's reach.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Kadderia's weapon attacks count as magical for the purposes of overcoming damage resistances and immunities.

trait.name: Ring of Free Action
entries: Kadderia is not slowed by difficult terrain, and magic cannot cause them to be {@condition restrained}, {@condition staggered|LevelUp}, or slow their movement.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Kadderia attacks once with their bite and casts a spell.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) magical piercing damage.

bonus.name: Create Spell Slots
entries: Kadderia can expend one spell slot and either gain a number of sorcery points equal to the slot's level or create a spell slot by expending sorcery points (1st-level: 2 points, 2nd-level: 3 points, 3rd-level: 5 points).

trait.name: Evasion
entries: When Xeraz is subjected to an effect that allows him to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, he instead takes no damage if he succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if he fails.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Xeraz's weapon attacks count as magical for the purposes of overcoming damage resistances and immunities.

trait.name: Magic Items
entries: Xeraz also carries a periapt of proof against poison, potion of invisibility, potion of speed, and a green bag of tricks.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: Xeraz has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of his allies is within 5 feet of the creature and not {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Sneak Attack
entries: Once per turn, Xeraz deals 10 ({@damage 3d6}) extra damage when he hits a creature with a finesse weapon (including his claws) or ranged weapon attack. To apply this damage, Xeraz must not have disadvantage, and his target must be within 5 feet of another enemy of the target who is not {@condition incapacitated}. Alternatively, Xeraz can apply sneak attack damage if he has advantage on the attack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Xeraz attacks twice with his claws.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) magical slashing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it makes a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw, falling {@condition prone} on a failure.

bonus.name: Cunning Action (1/turn)
entries: Xeraz can take a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, Hide, or Use Object action, Sleight of Hand check, or to use thieves' tools to disarm a trap or open a lock.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: When an attcker Xeraz can see hits him with an attack, Xeraz can use his reaction to halve the attck's damage against him.

trait.name: Echolocation
entries: The swarm can't use blindsight while {@condition deafened}.

trait.name: Keen Hearing
entries: The swarm has advantage on Perception checks that rely on hearing.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and move through any opening large enough for a Tiny creature. It can't gain HP or temporary hit points. While the swarm is bloodied, it becomes Medium size.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage, or 3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage if the swarm is bloodied.

action.name: Slicing Flurry
entries: Each creature sharing a space with the swarm makes a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 4d4}) slashing damage, or 5 ({@damage 2d4}) slashing damage if the swarm is bloodied, on a failure, or half as much on a success. Creatures can gain advantage on this saving throw by choosing to fall {@condition prone} as a free action.

trait.name: Sporous Resilience (2/Day)
entries: If the spore thrall is reduced to 0 hit points by damage that isn't necrotic or from a critical hit, it is instead reduced to 1 hit point, falls {@condition prone}, and is {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn, appearing to be dead. This ruse can be detected with a {@dc 11} Medicine check.

action.name: Grab
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 11}). Until the grapple ends, the zombie can't grab another target.

action.name: Spore Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one {@condition grappled} target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d10 + 1}) piercing damage and the target makes a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw, becoming infected with {@disease eltare's malaise|LevelUp} on a failure.

spell.name: Template Spell

components.m: opal worth at least 1,000gp, consumed by the spell

entries.name: Target
entries: A mirror on the same plane of existence as you

entries.name: Area
entries: 10-foot cube

entries.name: Saving Throw
entries: Dexterity halves and negates deafness

A permanent, immovable zone of antimagic fills the area, suppressing all magical effects within it. At the DM's discretion, sufficiently powerful artifacts and deities may be able to ignore the zone's effects. The zone is dispelled only if more than 10 percent of its area overlaps with that of another antimagic zone spell (which is also dispelled).

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: For each slot above 6th, the aberration's AC increases by 1, its hit points increase by 10, and when it deals damage with an attack it deals {@dice 1d4} extra damage.

spell.name: Abstraction

components.m: a mechanical device that has been completely disassembled

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature

entries.name: Saving Throw
entries: Charisma negates

You imagine a creature you can see within range in a deconstructed and simplified form. The target must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the target becomes a barely recognisable, abstracted version of itself until the spell ends.

An abstracted creature's speed is halved, it takes a -2 penalty to AC and Dexterity saving throws, and it can't use reactions. On its turn, it can use either an action or a bonus action, not both. Regardless of the creature's abilities or magic items, it can't make more than one melee or ranged attack during its turn.
At the end of each of its turns, an abstracted target repeats the saving throw to end the spell's effect on it.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: You can choose one additional target for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Animated Painting

entries.name: Target
entries: A single drawing or painting that is Medium or smaller

The scene depicted within an artwork transforms into an extradimensional space containing any objects or creatures depicted within the painting, and such objects and creatures are manifested as impressions. The extradimensional space is a 100-foot cube, unless the depicted space would be smaller. The picture's frame forms the entryway into this extradimensional space. No spells, attacks, or environmental effects can cross into or out of this extradimensional space, but creatures and objects can pass through it unimpeded.

Any object or creature manifested as an impression by this spell retains their proportions, scale, and artistic style. For example, a painting depicting a 6-inch long dragon made of abstract shapes targeted by this spell would manifest a Tiny-sized abstract dragon impression.

Non-magical objects manifested as impressions by this spell are functional but difficult to use, and any attacks or checks made with them are made at disadvantage. Magical objects manifested as impressions have no magical qualities and act as mundane versions of themselves.

Any creatures manifested as impressions are animated under your control. Each impression has Constitution 10, Intelligence 3, Wisdom 3, and Charisma 10, as well as a walking speed, swim speed, and fly speed of 30 feet if the depicted creature could walk, swim, or fly, respectively. When you command an impression to attack, it makes a single melee attack against a creature within 5 feet of it. The type of damage dealt by an impression is bludgeoning damage, unless the impression depicts a more specific damage type, such as a knight's sword dealing slashing damage or a mummy dealing necrotic damage. Otherwise, an impression's statistics are determined by its size and artistic style as per Table: Animated Painting. If you manifest 4 or more Small or Tiny impressions, instead of controlling each impression individually they function as an impression swarm. Attacks made against an impression swarm deal half damage. When an impression drops to 0 hit points, it is destroyed.

You can use a bonus action to mentally command any impression made with this spell while it is within 500 feet. When you combine multiple impressions using this spell, you may simultaneously give them all the same command, which can be specific commands or more general orders such as 'attack this creature' or 'guard this area'. Without commands the impressions act accordingly to the scene they were depicted in, know only the world depicted in the piece, and, barring any obvious interactions, act only to defend themselves.

When the spell ends, any non-impression creature or object within the extradimensional space is dropped outside of it into the closest unoccupied spaces to the entryway. Any remaining impressions returns inanimate to the painting, though any impressions that were destroyed are now absent from the artwork.

entries.caption: Animate Painting
rows: +5 to hit, {@damage 2d6} damage (or {@damage 1d6} damage if below half hit points)

entries.caption: Artistic Style
rows: Abstract impressions are difficult to read, and attacks made against them have disadvantage.
Expressionist impressions are otherworldly and unnerving in motion, and creatures hostile towards you are {@condition rattled|LevelUp} while they can see an expressionist impression.
Minimalist impressions are made of thick, durable shapes and gain a +4 AC bonus.
Realistic impressions can only be determined as unreal by using an action to make an Investigation check with a DC equal to your spell save DC.
Sketches or pencil impressions are almost perfectly flat and can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The duration of the spell increases by 10 minutes for each slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Chromatic Beam

components.m: a diamond worth at least 50 gp

entries.name: Area
entries: Line 30 feet long and 5 feet wide

entries.name: Saving Throw
entries: Dexterity halves

You pour prismatic energy into a gemstone refracting the energy until it fires off as a chromatic beam in a direction you choose. Choose red (fire), orange (acid), yellow (lightning), green (poison), blue (cold), or indigo (thunder) for the colour of beam you create. Each creature in the area takes {@damage 4d8} damage of the chosen type.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Glamour
entries: You distort light and colours around yourself so that you are subtly more appealing, masking any untoward marks and blemishes. Until the spell ends or use an action to dismiss it, you are glamoured by an illusion that can slightly alter your appearance. These minor changes include hair style and length, eye colouration, sex, signs of age or tiredness such as crows feet and bags under the eyes, concealing or adding tattoos or other marks or blemishes, and general signs of hygiene or cleanliness. You cannot change the perception of your height or race with this spell or disguise yourself as a creature of a different size category, and your limb structure remains the same; for example, if you're bipedal, you can't use this spell to appear as a quadruped.

The glamour does not hold up to physical inspection. A creature that tries to grab illusory hair, for example, finds its hand passes straight through the figment. To see through your glamour without such an inspection, a creature must use its action to make an Investigation check against your spell save DC.
The duration of this spell increases when you reach 5th level (30 minutes) and 11th level (1 hour).

spell.name: Pigment Cloud

entries.name: Area
entries: 20-foot radius sphere

You create a heavily obscured area of multicoloured fog. The fog spreads around corners and can be dispersed by a moderate wind (at least 10 miles per hour). Any creature that moves through this cloud on their turn or that starts their turn there is covered in a rainbow of colourful pigments and while covered in this way they leave multicoloured footprints and trails of pigment behind them as they move for the duration of the spell. Checks made to see or track creatures covered in such pigment are made at advantage. These pigments are removed if the affected creature is fully submerged in water or similar liquid.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The spell's radius increases by 20 feet for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Prismatic Mess

components.m: a paint or pigment set containing multiple colours

entries.name: Area
entries: 35-foot cube

Even a chaotic mess can be made useful using prisimancy. You flood the area around yourself with multicoloured pigments and each creature (except you) in a 35-foot cube centered on you must make a Dexterity saving throw. For each target, roll a {@dice d8} to determine which colour of pigment affects it.

items.name: 1 - Red
entries: The target takes {@damage 6d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: 2 - Orange
entries: The target takes {@damage 6d6} acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: 3 - Yellow
entries: The target takes {@damage 6d6} lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: 4 - Green
entries: The target takes {@damage 6d6} poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: 5 - Blue
entries: The target takes {@damage 6d6} cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: 6 - Indigo
entries: On a failed save, the target is {@condition restrained}. It must make a Strength saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful saving throw it frees itself form the constricting pigments and is no longer {@condition restrained}.

items.name: 7 - Violet
entries: On a failed save, the target is {@condition blinded}. At the start of each of the creature's turns, it makes a Constitution saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

items.name: 8 - Special
entries: THe target is afflicted by two pigments. Roll twice more, rerolling any 8.

spell.name: Resplendent Refraction

components.m: a gemstone worth at least 50 gp

entries.name: Target
entries: One willing creature

entries.name: Saving Throw
entries: Constitution halves

The target's skin becomes reflective and faceted like a finely cut gemstone. Until the spell ends, the target can use their action to fire a beam of reflected light in a 30-foot line. Each creature in that area must make a Constitution saving throw, taking an amount of damage determined by the light level around the target on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

In addition, whenever the target would take radiant damage (from a source other than this spell), it may instead reflect is as a reaction. If it does, it gains resistance to the triggering damage and may immediately fire a beam at the attacker as if it were in bright light.

entries.caption: Resplendent Refraction
rows: {@damage 5d10} radiant damage, and on a failed save the creature is also {@condition blinded} until the end of their next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: This spell's damage increases by {@damage 1d10} in both dim light and bright light for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Burst of Strength
entries: In a sudden eruption of fortitude, you break bonds in inhuman fasion. If you are {@condition grappled} by a creature or non-magical restraints when you cast this spell, you immediately escape the grapple.

Alternatively, if you have been {@condition grappled} or {@condition restrained} by a spell or a magical effect or item due to a failed saving throw, you immediately re-roll the saving throw with advantage. In either case, you suffer a level of {@condition fatigue|LevelUp} at the end of your turn.

spell.name: Consume Vigour

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature

entries.name: Saving Throw
entries: Constitution halves

You rend the lifeforce from a creature to sustain yourself. The target of this spell takes {@damage 6d8} necrotic damage. Undead and constructs are immune to this spell. If this damage reduces it to 0 hit points, it is killed and you reduce 1 level of your choice of either your {@condition fatigue|LevelUp} or {@condition strife|LevelUp}.

spell.name: Dementing Touch

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature

entries.name: Saving Throw
entries: Wisdom negates

Your touch implants a vile plague in a creature's mind. While a creature is under the effects of this spell and can see you, you can use an action to force it to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, it takes a level of {@condition strife|LevelUp}. You can only inflict a number of levels in {@condition strife|LevelUp} equal to half your proficiency bonus in this way each time you cast this spell.
The target knows it has been enchanted and can recognise you as the source of this effect with an Insight check against your spell save DC.

spell.name: Draining Nova

components.m: a handheld silver cauldron worth at least 50 gp

entries.name: Area
entries: 30-foot radius

entries.name: Saving Throw
entries: Special

Creatures in the area make a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 4d8} necrotic damage and suffering one level of {@condition fatigue|LevelUp} on a failed save and avoiding the {@condition fatigue|LevelUp} on a successful one. For each level of {@condition fatigue|LevelUp} you cause in this manner, you gain {@dice 1d8} temporary hit points.

spell.name: Enervating Light

entries.name: Saving Throw
entries: Constitution negates

You conjure a mote of sickly light at a point within range. The mote emits bright light in a 20-foot radius, and dim light for another 20 feet. A non-undead creature that starts its turn in the bright light, or enters the bright light for the first time on a turn, must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or suffer a level of {@condition fatigue|LevelUp}. Additionally, if it suffers this {@condition fatigue|LevelUp}, all undead in the area of bright light gain {@dice 2d8} temporary hit points and those in the area of dim light gain {@dice 1d8} temporary hit points. On a successful save, a creature is immune to the effect until it leaves the area.

spell.name: Fatigued Bargain

entries.name: Target
entries: One willing creature

Your magic suppresses a creature's inhibitions, urging out its own self-destructive strength. Until the end of your next turn, it ignores the effects of {@condition fatigue|LevelUp}. At the end of the duration, it takes an amount of psychic damage equal to {@dice 1d4} x the number of levels of {@condition fatigue|LevelUp} it is suffering. Additionally, on its turn, it can take an additional action, which can't be used for casting a spell other than a cantrip with a casting time of 1 action. If it takes this additional action, it suffers a level of {@condition fatigue|LevelUp} at the end of its turn.

spell.name: Fortified Will

entries.name: Target
entries: One willing creature

You harden a creature's mind with an unbending willpower. For the duration, if the creature fails a saving throw against an effect that would cause it to become {@condition charmed}, {@condition confused|LevelUp}, {@condition frightened}, or {@condition debilitated|LevelUp}, it can use its reaction to automatically succeed on the save instead. If it does, it takes a level of {@condition strife|LevelUp} and the spell ends.

spell.name: Gate From Beyond
entries: You rend the veil to create a short-range portal from your location to any place you can see, visualise, or describe by stating a distance and direction such as 200 feet straight downward or 400 feet upward at a 30-degree angle to the southeast. The other end of the portal appears within 5 feet of you and you suffer a level of {@condition strife|LevelUp}.

A creature within 5 feet of either end of the portal can use 5 feet of movement to step through, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the other end. If there is no such space, it is moved to the nearest unoccupied space, taking {@dice 1d10} force damage for every 5 feet moved. The portal remains open for as long as you maintain concentration and remain within 5 feet of one end of it, but for the duration of your concentration you suffer an additional level of {@condition strife|LevelUp} at the end of each of your turns after the first.

spell.name: Inner Solace

entries.name: Target
entries: One willing creature

You turn a creature's exhaustion into a well of inner strength. While under the effect of this spell, the target gains a number of temporary hit points equal to {@dice 1d6} x its combined levels of {@condition fatigue|LevelUp} and {@condition strife|LevelUp} at the start of each of its turns. Any temporary hit points remaining are lost when the spell ends.
Additionally, if its total levels of {@condition fatigue|LevelUp} and {@condition strife|LevelUp} are 3 or more, the target gains advantage on its first attack roll each turn.

spell.name: Muddle

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature

entries.name: Saving Throw
entries: Constitution or Wisdom negates

You attempt to disorient a creature. Choose either {@condition fatigue|LevelUp} or {@condition strife|LevelUp}. If you choose {@condition fatigue|LevelUp}, the creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or suffer a level of {@condition fatigue|LevelUp}. If you choose {@condition strife|LevelUp}, the creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or suffer a level of {@condition strife|LevelUp}. Regardless, the effect only lasts until the end of the creature's next turn. This spell fails if the target already has a level of {@condition fatigue|LevelUp} or {@condition strife|LevelUp} (whichever the spell is meant to inflict).

You can inflict an additional level of {@condition fatigue|LevelUp} or {@condition strife|LevelUp} when you reach 5th level (2), 11th level (3), and 17th level (4). These levels must be either all {@condition fatigue|LevelUp} or all {@condition strife|LevelUp}.

spell.name: Reckless March

entries.name: Target
entries: You and up to three willing creatures
You suppress exhaustion in your traveling companions. For the duration, the targets move at double speed during overworld travel.

When this spell ends, the target creatures must roll a single Constitution saving throw against a difficulty of 10 + the number of hours of double-speed travel undertaken during the spell. On a failure, they suffer levels of {@condition fatigue|LevelUp} equal to half the number of hours of the double-speed travel (minimum 1).

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: You target an additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Sufferer's Pact

entries.name: Target
entries: One willing creature

You burn away weakness to reveal inner strength. The target takes {@dice 4d8} force damage. Then, at the start of each of its turns, it gains {@dice 2d8} temporary hit points. When this spell ends, the target removes its choice of one level of {@condition fatigue|LevelUp} or {@condition strife|LevelUp}. Any temporary hit points remaining are lost when the spell ends.

spell.name: Sufferer's Strike

entries.name: Saving Throw
entries: Special

Your weapon thrums with the power of your misery. As part of casting this spell, make a melee spell attack against the target. On a hit, you deal your weapon damage plus {@dice 2d8} force damage. This damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each level of {@condition fatigue|LevelUp} and {@condition strife|LevelUp} you are suffering. If the total of your {@condition fatigue|LevelUp} and {@condition strife|LevelUp} levels is 3 or more, the target makes a Constitution saving throw or suffers one level of {@condition fatigue|LevelUp} or {@condition strife|LevelUp} (your choice).

You can inflict an additional level of {@condition fatigue|LevelUp} or {@condition strife|LevelUp} when you reach 11th level (2) and 17th level (3). These levels must be either all {@condition fatigue|LevelUp} or all {@condition strife|LevelUp}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: The base damage of this spell increases by {@dice 1d8} for every two spell slot levels above 2nd.

spell.name: Transmute Exhaustion

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature

entries.name: Saving Throw
entries: Constitution negates

All the target creature's levels of {@condition strife|LevelUp} are transformed into {@condition fatigue|LevelUp}, or vice-versa. This spell fails if the target's total levels of {@condition fatigue|LevelUp} or {@condition strife|LevelUp} would equal 7 or more.

spell.name: Transfer Exhaustion

entries.name: Target
entries: One willing creature

Your touch draws out a creature's exhaustion. Choose a number of levels of either {@condition fatigue|LevelUp} or {@condition strife|LevelUp} up to the number of levels it is suffering and take them, removing them from the target and adding them to your own.

spell.name: Fey Tongue

components.m: a piece of parchment with Elvish, Sylvan, or Primordial writing on it

entries: You gain a +10 bonus on Insight checks made to understand the meaning of any spoken Sylvan, Elvish, or Primordial that you hear, or any written text in those languages that you can touch. In addition, you gain an expertise die on Performance and Persuasion checks for the duration.

spell.name: Spellbound Oath

components.m: two matching pieces of jewelry worth at least 25 gold each

entries.name: Target
entries: Two willing creatures
This spell binds two creatures to an agreement spoken as part of the casting of the spell in a language that both parties understand.

The agreement must include a promise by both parties to do or refrain from doing something specific. The promises do not need to be the same or equal but mustn't be obviously harmful to either creature. For example, an archfey may promise to restore the freedom of a loved one in exchange for a mortal becoming their emissary.

A creature attempting to act in a way that will breach the terms must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, they find themselves unable to act as intended, ending their turn if they are in combat. Regardless, it suffers 52 ({@damage 8d12}) psychic damage for the attempt. Damage from this spell cannot instantly kill through massive damage, though the creature makes death saving throws as usual.
